showdown.description: Showdown is a JavaScript implementation of the Markdown specification, available from [https://github.com/showdownjs/showdown](https://github.com/showdownjs/showdown). It permits enhancement via extensions and the ~m:showdown~ package uses that feature to implement styles for use in this documentation manager.

load.description: Loads the Showdown JavaScript module into the HEAD of the document.

decode.description: Decodes a block of markup text, calling the ~l:callback|k|core~ once for every occurrence of a specified pattern. The pattern used here is%0a%0a~m:/˜([^˜]+)˜/g~%0a%0awhich matches everything between 2 tilde (~m:˜~) characters. The content of the match is interpreted by the callback, which returns a replacement string. ~m:Callback~ is a variable that is loaded by the markdown module once for each matched string. An ~l:on|k|core!on callback~ event is then raised to allow the script to handle the processing by taking the content of the callback, processing it and putting it back.
decode.examples: set the content of Container to showdown decode Markup with Callback
